basics.name: Jeremiah Dy
basics.label: Student
basics.summary: I am studying for a B.S. in Computer Science with a concentration in data science at the University of Hawaii's Department of Information and Computer Sciences. I expect to graduate in Spring, 2024.

work.summary: Computer science intern primarily focused on developing C-based and Python scripts
highlights: Utilize AFSIM software to create extensible models and simulation output data
Develop Python scripts to run large design of experiments
Leverage a high-performance computing cluster to run large jobs in parallel
Promoted from previous Shift Leader position
Teach new employees the basic recipes and skills
Grading student assignments and providing feedback
One-on-one meetings with students as requested

volunteer.summary: Occasional volunteer at food distribution events across O'ahu
highlights: Sort, pack, and offload food to families that drive-by
Volunteered at multiple location over volunteer history, including Lighthouse Outreach-Waiphu and King's Chapel Outreach-Hawai'i Kai

awards.title: Regents Scholarship
awards.summary: A four-year tuition waver scholarship awarded to incoming freshmen who complete a rigorous high school curriculum with a minimum overall GPA of 3.5 at a Hawai'i high school. Addtionally, reciepients should have remarkable extracurricular activities and a total SAT score of at least 1340 or combined ACT score of at least 29. Regent scholars must maintain full-time student status (as defined via federal definition) with at least a 3.2 GPA in all semesters.
